{"step_by_step_thinking": "Porosity in the resin can occur due to various reasons such as inadequate mixing, improper curing, or the presence of air bubbles. In the case of methyl methacrylate, porosity is most likely to occur near the borders of the denture. This is because when the flask is placed too soon, it can trap air or cause incomplete polymerization in the areas where the resin meets the borders of the denture. Therefore, the answer is B. Near the borders.", "answer_choice": "B"}
